comment: Hey AK lectures, just a heads up; you used Molality and not Molairty. Therefore this work is wrong, but it should be fixable if add an annotation for people of the future. Love your videos dude

Just curious as to why you used Kg instead of the given volume of 0.3L? Couldn't you have used concentration(H+) = [moles(H+) = moles (HN03)] divided by volume of H20 and plugged that answer into the -log (concentration of H+) equation? It gives the exact same answer and didn't require conversion of volume of H20 into Kg.
Hi.  Thanks for your videos.  I have a question about Molarity.  You calculated it as mol/kg, but I thought that was molality.  Which one are we supposed to use?
+LONDHE93 Yeah he did a mistake. Molarity is mols of solute/L of sol'n . He used molality. Which is wrong.
Weijie Yao Thanks for clearing it up mate! :)
its actually the same thing isnt it? 1 liter = 1 kg right? So basically you will get the same answer. He just wanted to use the density to convert.
